customer_name: Joe R. Adair Outdoor Education Center
site_name: Joe R. Adair Outdoor Education Center

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed a written program of veterinary care for the avian species maintained at the facility. The
written program of veterinary care is needed to ensure that the facility understands the expectations of the attending
veterinarian regarding the veterinary care and husbandry needs of the regulated animals, affirming that both parties have
a clear understanding of their roles to appropriately manage the species on hand. The facility should ensure that the
written program of veterinary care is available for review during all USDA inspections, with the documented arrangements
to include regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the facility.
Correct by October 20, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written environmental enhancement plan for the birds on-hand at the facility. Maintaining a
documented plan ensures adequate provisions are in place to suitably promote and sustain the psychological well-being
and needs of the avian species housed. An enrichment plan must be developed, documented, followed, and approved by
the attending veterinarian, in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and currently accepted professional
standards.
Correct by October 20, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the authorized person.
n
